wikitext.*:
On [[17 May]] [[1954]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|a letter]] to [[Wikipedia:Sir Henry Willink, 1st Baronet|Henry Willink]]'''.<ref>{{CG|C}}, pp. 431-2</ref>

*'''Subject:''' Discussion about [[C.S. Lewis]], academic matters.
*'''Publication:''' A substantial portion of the letter was quoted by Brian Barbour in his article "Lewis and Cambridge", published in the journal [[Modern Philology 96, no. 4|''Modern Philology 96'', no. 4]] (cf., pp. 463â€“4). A shorter and slightly edited version of the extract was published in ''[[The Collected Letters of C.S. Lewis: Narnia, Cambridge, and Joy 1950-1963]]'' (p. 475; here wrongly dated 18 May).<ref name=Addenda>{{webcite|author=[[Christina Scull]], [[Wayne G. Hammond]]|articleurl=http://www.hammondandscull.com/addenda/chronology.html|articlename=Addenda and Corrigenda to ''The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide'' (2006) Vol. 1: Chronology|dated=|website=HS|accessed=20 May 2012}}</ref>
